page.title: 08FARMING
page.content: normally the car park..a great mountain of apples from all over the surrounding area brought by wheelbarrow;in plastic bags in farm trailers and of course in large lorries. There are also smaller areas of fruit production more concerned with soft fruit such as goosesberries, raspberries and strawberries, with a "pick your own" style of marketing. Some of the individual farms are quite large(75 hectares and over) though they are by no means as large as the arable farms of East Anglia for example,with their 300 hectares+.In the 2 kilometre squares around Dipford all the land is owned by seven farms..viz.Dipford Farm,Higher Dipford Farm,Middle Sweethay,Lower Sweethay Canonsgrove Farm,Wrexon Farm and Fullards Farm.
